sentence: Unilever PLC ( UL ) will begin trading ex-dividend on February 08, 2017.
A cash dividend payment of $0.339 per share is scheduled to be paid on March 15, 2017.
Shareholders who purchased UL prior to the ex-dividend date are eligible for the cash dividend payment.
This represents an -3.14% decrease from the prior dividend payment.
The previous trading day's last sale of UL was $41.14, representing a -15.99% decrease from the 52 week high of $48.97 and a 6.64% increase over the 52 week low of $38.58.
UL is a part of the Basic Industries sector, which includes companies such as Procter & Gamble Company ( PG ) and Unilever NV ( UN ).
Zacks Investment Research reports UL's forecasted earnings growth in 2017 as 6.97%, compared to an industry average of 4%.
For more information on the declaration, record and payment dates, visit the UL Dividend History page.
Our Dividend Calendar has the full list of stocks that have an ex-dividend today.

The following ETF(s) have UL as a top-10 holding:

The top-performing ETF of this group is VNQI with an decrease of -6.07% over the last 100 days.
It also has the highest percent weighting of UL at 2.48%.
